SampleCAT

Class Device.DisplayOutput

  • java.lang.Object
    • SampleCAT.Device.DisplayOutput
  • Enclosing class:
    Device

    static class Device.DisplayOutput
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for processing terminal display information.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) boolean Active
      Specifies whether the display output object is currently in use.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DisplayOutput()
      The constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void cleanup()
      Frees all resources when the object will no longer be used.
      (package private) void init()
      Initializes the display output processor for output operation.
      (package private) void release()
      Releases the display.
      (package private) void setLine(int lineno, java.lang.String contents)
      Fills contents into the line specified by lineno.
      (package private) boolean setLineData(int[] line, java.lang.String[] data, int rows, int columns)
      Line number of the sample terminal will be passed whenever changed.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • Active

        boolean Active
        Specifies whether the display output object is currently in use. This is the case between ini() and release().

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisplayOutput

        DisplayOutput()
        The constructor. No further action.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
   throws jpos.JposException
        Initializes the display output processor for output operation. Updates display contents, if changed since last release.
        Throws:
        jpos.JposException - If initialization fails or display output device is not in an operable status.

      • release

        void release()
        Releases the display. Further display output will be stored internally.

      • setLine

        void setLine(int lineno,
             java.lang.String contents)
        Fills contents into the line specified by lineno. lineno must be between 0 and 3.
        Parameters:
        lineno - Line number to be set.
        contents - New contents of the line.

      • cleanup

        void cleanup()
        Frees all resources when the object will no longer be used.

      • setLineData

        boolean setLineData(int[] line,
                    java.lang.String[] data,
                    int rows,
                    int columns)
        Line number of the sample terminal will be passed whenever changed. Since the sample terminal works with 4 lines with 40 columns each, the amount of lines and characters per line must be reduced if the application supports less lines and / or less columns.
        Parameters:
        line - Line no. specified by terminal (in). Line no to be used during output (out).
        data - Line contents to be used during output (out).
        rows - No. of line to be used for output.
        columns - Maximum columns per line to be used during output.
        Returns:
        true if output lines have been changed, else false.
